availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamon F. Branson (Casey Co, Ky, farmer and first lieut (U.S.A.))

body.p: Casey County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Branson and Lucindy Branson. Married to Ann P. Short Branson. Resident in Casey County, Kentucky, in 1850. Served in 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from December 23, 1863, to January 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Casey County, District 2, p. 313B.
